content: Suppose a person is travelling from London to Edinburgh and stopping at three different rest stops. They purchase a book, a bottle of whisky, and a box of shortbread cookies, costing £10, £30, and £5 respectively. Write a MATLAB code to calculate the total cost of the items purchased and the average cost per item.

Certainly! You can calculate the total cost and the average cost per item using MATLAB with the following code:

```matlab
% Prices of items
price_book = 10;     % Cost of the book in pounds
price_whisky = 30;   % Cost of the whisky in pounds
price_cookies = 5;   % Cost of the shortbread cookies in pounds

% Total cost calculation
total_cost = price_book + price_whisky + price_cookies;

% Number of items
num_items = 3;

% Average cost per item calculation
average_cost = total_cost / num_items;

% Display the results
fprintf('Total cost of the items purchased: £%.2f\n', total_cost);
fprintf('Average cost per item: £%.2f\n', average_cost);
```

This code calculates the total cost by summing up the prices of the book, whisky, and cookies. It then calculates the average cost by dividing the total cost by the number of items. Finally, it displays the results using formatted output.
